intro: Ionidium polygalifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf ionidium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Ionidium polygalifolium thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
